abstract.p: Dave Matthews Band is set to play sold-out concerts at Giants Stadium; photo (S)

block.p: The Dave Matthews Band is a bona fide music phenomenon, with a fan base that has been consistently growing to the point where they now sell out multiple stadium performances. Taking on a Deadhead quality as far as cultish devotion, the band fuses rock and jazz with folk, blues and country roots, and has become a grass roots favorite with countless fan clubs, Internet fan sites and bootleg albums.

Touring incessantly and fronted by the rich, edgy (and sometimes unintelligible) vocals of Mr. Matthews, one of rock's most commanding vocalists, the Dave Matthews Band has released high-quality albums that feature percolating beats, rigorous guitarwork, gorgeous melodies and an imposing horn section.

The Dave Matthews Band is a bona fide music phenomenon, with a fan base that has been consistently growing to the point where they now sell out multiple stadium performances. Taking on a Deadhead quality as far as cultish devotion, the band fuses rock and jazz with folk, blues and country roots, and has become a grass roots favorite with countless fan clubs, Internet fan sites and bootleg albums.

Touring incessantly and fronted by the rich, edgy (and sometimes unintelligible) vocals of Mr. Matthews, one of rock's most commanding vocalists, the Dave Matthews Band has released high-quality albums that feature percolating beats, rigorous guitarwork, gorgeous melodies and an imposing horn section.

When the band plays its sold-out concerts at Giants Stadium on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday night, expect music from all their albums -- 1994's ''Under the Table and Dreaming,'' 1996's ''Crash,'' and 1998's ''Before These Crowded Streets.'' But don't expect anything to sound like their two live discs, released last year -- ''Listener Supported'' and ''Live at Luther College.'' They never play anything the same way twice.
